lexUnit.name: soar.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: increase rapidly above the usual level on some scale

sentence.text: TOKYO share prices soared yesterday , reversing a slide that had wiped more than 10 p.c. off the Nikkei stock average since the start of the week .
PETROL prices would soar by 20p a gallon under a radical package of measures aimed at slashing pollution in Britain .
PROSPECTS of an early New Year interest rate cut rose yesterday as share prices soared by almost Â£10 billion .
Oil prices have soared above forty dollars a barrel , their highest level in a decade , which is almost certain to provoke another round of petrol price increases .
Birth rates soared and career women sank in prestige to the level of drop-outs in the great breeding stakes .
But when market rates soared to fifteen per cent mortgage rates went up with them , pushing repayment bills up by as much as 50 per cent .
Worse still , high interest rates caused unemployment rates to soar ( see the graph on page 44 ) .
They claim sales , on the all-important run-up to Christmas , are set to soar .
The price of Paribas shares has soared by more than 10 per cent this week .
The shares soared l2p to 143p on hopes of a generous buy-out price .
Tom O'Reilly was an ascetic former Treasurer of the Corporation who had been never known to smile even when the company 's blue chip shares soared to dizzy peaks on Wall Street .
Channel tunnel funding crisis deepens : Consortium seeks fresh finance after costs soar by 50 percent to 7 billion pounds

Over 1992 , the total value of the life fund soared 20 per cent , thanks to the surge in equity prices which followed the pound 's departure from the exchange rate mechanism last September .
UK profits soared 60 per cent to Â£60 million as the loss-making shirt and fabrics businesses were turned around .
The level of tension soared as those present recalled that a minimum of 169 votes was required for success on the first ballot .
The FTSE 100 index soaring 36.3 to a record high of 2918.6 , adding about Â£5 billion to share values
Storm Group -- makers of both the Wombles and Shoe People characters -- has seen sales soar SIX-FOLD in the past six months .
The film had cost at least $25 million ( and may have soared as high as $33 million if all costs were considered ) which , in 1970 dollars , put it way above the epic category .
AFTER soaring above $19 a barrel on Tuesday , oil prices fell back last night to $18.84 in spite of an announcement by Iran that it would cut its production next month .
Greece took emergency action on two consecutive days in October as air pollution soared above safety levels .
BRITAIN 'S unemployment soared above 2.6 million for the first time in over four years yesterday after a bigger than expected surge in the number of people out of work .
Rescues to animals in distress soared by 26pc from 232 in 1990 to 293 in 1991 .
Meanwhile , Microsoft 's net income for January to March jumped by 36% to $143m as sales soared by 40% to $158m .
NATIONAL Power boss John Baker 's pay soared by 157 PER CENT last year , it was revealed yesterday .
Sales of the low-priced Czech motor have soared by a quarter in crisis-hit Britain this year .
Earnings per share soared from 36p to 62p .
But there was more to it than that as Swansea soared from Fourth Division to First with only a season 's rest .

Pre-tax profits soared from Â£21.4 million to almost Â£32 million and the company joined Iceland Frozen Foods yesterday in announcing turnover that topped Â£1 billion for the first time , jumping from Â£920 million to Â£1.05 billion .
Almost at once , the decibel level inside soared from an angry mumble to a full-blown shouting match .
After the first rotary press was established at the Daily Times , that paper 's circulation soared from 25,000 in 1951 to 55,000 in 1955 ; ten years later , it reached 120,000 copies daily .
The demand for cheap beef arose when North American beef soared in price , -- cattle ranching in South America is far less costly and a lucrative business deal for wealthy landowners .
Britannic life fund soars in value
The price had soared to 250p before crashing last year .

Rail fares to soar as grants are cut .
Germany 's retail sales soared by 9.2% in the 12 months to November .
SERIOUS business fraud cases in the UK soared alarmingly by over 28 per cent in 1992 , to Â£468 million .

The price of cobalt soared and the industry suddenly had to pour much time and money into redesigning the magnets in loudspeakers , using less expensive ceramic materials instead of cobalt .
Unless the price soars to beat Â£4.57 in the next week , it 's not worth bothering with the warrants .
And smart investors see future sales soaring , thanks to the Duchess of York 's poolside antics .
